The ministry labelled the references as "trashy ruminations" from a convicted criminal, urging their immediate rejection. These statements follow the US Department of Justice's release of extensive materials related to the late financier.

Elon Musk highlighted this seismic shift, noting India and China will drive over 43% of worldwide expansion. This surge, fueled by domestic strength and manufacturing, signals a changing global economic landscape beyond traditional Western markets.

description: The Economic Survey 2025–26 reads like a map of where Indian education quietly loses people—after Class 8, at the school-to-work handover, and in the steady outward rush of students seeking predictability. On Budget eve, the question isn’t another scheme. It’s whether spending will strengthen the weak joints—so families don’t have to keep paying privately for certainty.

title: In a first, Union Budget 2026 to be presented on Sunday
description: India's Union Budget 2026-27 will be presented on a Sunday for the first time in history, a significant procedural reform. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also achieves a record ninth consecutive budget presentation, marking a new milestone in the nation's financial reporting tradition.

Both 30-person Royal Rumble matches are set to headline the event, with predictions favoring Liv Morgan for the women's match and Roman Reigns or Bron Breakker for the men's.

'Mi, Sunetra Ajit Pawar, pratigya karte ki … ': 'Clock' ticks on in a changed NCP
description: With Sunetra Pawar, Ajit Pawar’s wife and a Rajya Sabha member, sworn in as deputy CM on Saturday, stepping into the role held by her husband, the state has formally entered a new and uncertain phase, shaped by the vacuum left by Dada’s death. Sunetra Pawar’s elevation may have filled the immediate constitutional vacuum, but it has also foregrounded larger, unresolved questions about the NCP’s future, the ruling Mahayuti alliance’s stability, and the direction the state’s politics will take in the absence of one of its most influential power brokers.

description: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to federal charges tied to drug trafficking and murder. US authorities say he led a billion-dollar drug ring uncovered through Operation Giant Slalom. Several alleged associates, including his wife, girlfriend, lawyer, and international partners, have been sanctioned, arrested, or face extradition, according to the FBI and US Department of Justice.

Setback for World No. 1 Sabalenka! Rybakina lifts Australian Open title
description: Elena Rybakina won the Australian Open title by defeating world number one Aryna Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4, avenging her 2023 final loss. She recovered from a 3-0 deficit in the deciding set, won five straight games, and sealed victory with an ace. The triumph marked her second Grand Slam title after Wimbledon 2022 and highlighted her mental strength and growing confidence on big stages.

The files also detail Epstein's attempts to introduce a Russian woman to the Duke, discussing potential meetings and a dinner at Buckingham Palace. Andrew has consistently denied any wrongdoing related to Epstein.

description: India's Union Budget, a key economic event, holds many fascinating historical details.  The Constitution calls it the 'Annual Financial Statement'.  This year's budget presentation on a Sunday is a first.  From colonial-era evening timings to the shift to February 1, traditions have evolved.  The 'bahi khata' now symbolizes Indian identity.  The railway budget is now integrated.

The match is a big occasion for Thiruvananthapuram fans. It is also India's last game before the T20 World Cup. India leads the series 3-1.

title: Jhanvi Kukreja murder case: Accused Shree Jogdhankar convicted; co-accused Diya Padalkar acquitted
description: In a 2021 murder case, a Mumbai sessions court is hearing the trial of Shree Jogdhankar and Diya Padalkar for the death of 19-year-old Jhanvi Kukreja. Kukreja was found dead with 48 injuries after a New Year's Eve party. The prosecution presented circumstantial evidence, including CCTV footage and forensic reports, to establish the chain of events.

title: ‘Criticism doesn’t matter’: Bhaker not setting medal goals for Asian Championship
description: Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker says criticism no longer affects her as she prepares for the Asian Rifle/Pistol Championship in Delhi. The 23-year-old credits maturity, experience, and public support since her two Paris 2024 bronze medals for her positive mindset. Competing at home excites rather than pressures her. Feeling fit and focused, Bhaker has avoided medal expectations, instead setting personal performance standards.

Despite a strong effort and recent wins against Djokovic, Sinner converted only two of 18 break points. He expressed gratitude for fan support and vowed to learn from the experience.

description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.
